author: George Lima Camara

review: I work where these are used on large screens above our desks to remind the front-line support engineers how the departments by product are performing their support duty. Being a back-line engineer who deals with engineering as a go-between, I have some lee-way in my hours, and even get to work at home.I was working over the holidays December 2013 and used my Android tablet to play some videos while nobody was around and I had nothing to do. That was the first time I'd seen "Luna" from Pixar. I fell in love with the idea of being able to "Cast" and ordered one.Since then I've ordered another one and have one on each TV.I really like having them, and I especially like being able to cast a version of America Unearthed on the TV from my Linux laptop using Chromium or from my tablet.I recommend them to others. Sorry Amazon, I can't justify the extra expense of your new product... yet...

author: Jimbo

review: I'm pretty happy with the google cromecast. I have had no issues with connecting or streaming. I can use my tv to surf the net. I can watch netflix or other apps that are on my cell, tablet, computer and watch them on my tv, plus I can still surf or play games on whichever device I used to send netflix (hulu, crackle, whichever you like) to my tv. If you don't have an hdmi input, there are converters to RCA for about $20. (If you do that, get the little box not the wire ones)The only thing that bothers me is that it still feels separate. Meaning that, at times I go to my "smart" DVD player to stream netflix, and I think that is because of the remote. (I'm guessing that is a guy thing...)
author: eDeal

review: I don't get the point of this device. If you already have an Internet Ready TV (like the Samsung we have), what additional streaming sources are enabled by this dongle? I ordered it assuming that I could stream videos on my TV from my PC browser. In theory you can, using Chrome and Google Cast - but the performance was terrible. I suspect if I souped up my PC, things may improve but then I am not willing to spend $2000 to make a $50 device work better.I suspect in the long run this is a great device but the current apps ecosystem is very basic, and almost all the sites I use for streaming did not have a dedicated app that uses Chromecast - hence, the need to use split browser.I will give this another try when there are more apps. The unit I got was promptly returned.
